I certainly hope the city does not renew their contract with J&J services. If a child gets hit crossing that busy intersection, it is the city who is at fault for paying an employee to sit by and not fulfill he job she/he is contracted to do. If you feel you must have a little coffee clatch at a job such as this, wait until after school starts, then sit there with your co-worker or other friends & chat to your heart's content. But as long as there are children you are supposed to guard and ensure their safe passage across a busy intersection, stay off your butt & keep your mind & eyes on your work! If this woman has worked at the job for so long her legs are too tired, then she should become a Walmart Greeter...they are always allowed to sit down & no child's safety is entrusted to there care.

What does it matter what the boys parents do or did. They matter is that the gorilla is dead because the zoo didn't have a protective enclosure. Plus the parents were being neglectful. The parents should be brought up for child endangerment for not watching there kid. The zoo should be fined and penalized for the enclosure. Point blank both parties are at fault.
